column2: The Controller remains legally responsible for any misuse of data by its vendors (Processors).
Includes assessing if the vendor has appropriate **cyberinsurance** to cover breaches/litigation.
Vendor controls must be as good as or better than the Controller's (e.g., evidenced by SOC 2, ISO 27001).
Prohibition on sharing data with unauthorized parties.
Vendor must not use data for any purpose other than those specified in the agreement.
Controller must retain the right to audit the vendor's security/privacy practices.
Vendors must be contractually obligated to apply the same privacy/security requirements to any downstream subcontractors.
Must specify whether data is returned or deleted at the end of the contract.
Umbrella contract for long-term work, including general security/privacy requirements.
Documents project-specific details, referencing the overarching MSA.
Specifies conditions of service (availability, response time) and remedies for failure.
Required by HIPAA. Obligates vendors (Business Associates) to comply with HIPAA security/privacy rules.
Agreements must clearly spell out the vendor's obligation to report known/suspected security incidents to the customer.
